extendedIngredients.name: chocolate chunks
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 package NESTLÉ® TOLL HOUSE® Chocolate Chunks

extendedIngredients.name: sugar cookie dough
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 package NESTLÉ® TOLL HOUSE® Refrigerated Cookie Dough (choose your favorite variety)

extendedIngredients.name: white morsels
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 package NESTLÉ® TOLL HOUSE® Red and Green Morsels

recipes.title: Chocolate Dipped Holiday Cookies

winePairing.pairingText: Cookies works really well with Cream Sherry, Madeira, and Prosecco. Sweet bubbly Prosecco doesn't overwhelm simple sugar or shortbread cookies, a sweet cream sherry complements spiced cookies, and madeira's nutty notes match cookies with nuts perfectly. One wine you could try is NV Solera Cream Sherry. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 17 dollars.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees (F.)Follow the directions on the cookie dough package to bake all of the cookies and allow them to cool completely.While the cookies are cooling, pour 1 cup of Evaporated Milk into a small glass bowl.Heat the Evaporated Milk in the microwave until steaming hot, but not boiling, about 90 seconds.Pour chocolate chunks into the hot milk, and allow to sit for 30 seconds.Use a small whisk to stir chocolate until completely incorporated.Dip each cookie into the chocolate, and place on a large sheet of parchment.Immediately sprinkle with red and green baking morsels.Allow the chocolate to set and harden before serving, about an hour. Place in refrigerator if needed.Enjoy!

steps.step: Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees (F.)Follow the directions on the cookie dough package to bake all of the cookies and allow them to cool completely.While the cookies are cooling, pour 1 cup of Evaporated Milk into a small glass bowl.
Heat the Evaporated Milk in the microwave until steaming hot, but not boiling, about 90 seconds.

Pour chocolate chunks into the hot milk, and allow to sit for 30 seconds.Use a small whisk to stir chocolate until completely incorporated.Dip each cookie into the chocolate, and place on a large sheet of parchment.Immediately sprinkle with red and green baking morsels.Allow the chocolate to set and harden before serving, about an hour.
